org.jetel.metadata

Enum DataFieldType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<DataFieldType>
      • org.jetel.metadata.DataFieldType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<DataFieldType>

    public enum DataFieldType
extends java.lang.Enum<DataFieldType>
    Enumeration of all build-in clover data types. STRING, DATE, NUMBER, INTEGER, LONG, DECIMAL, BYTE, CBYTE, BOOLEAN, LIST and MAP

        public static DataFieldType valueOf(java.lang.String name)

        Parameters:

      • getName

        name of type

      • getByteIdentifier

        public byte getByteIdentifier()
        This byte identifier is used by metadata serialisation into a byte stream. (This is used by CloverDataReader/Writer to serialise used metadata into data file.) DataFieldType.ordinal() could be used instead, but this could be non-intentionally changed by adding new data type. So custom ordinal number is used instead to ensure stability against code changes.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Enum<DataFieldType>

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(DataFieldContainerType containerType)
        Returns string form of this data field type in relation with a container type. For example integer data type with
      • SINGLE container returns 'integer'
      • LIST container returns 'integer[]'
      • MAP container returns 'map[string, integer]'
Parameters:
containerType -
Returns:

  • getInternalValueClass

    public java.lang.Class<?> getInternalValueClass()
    This class is type of internal representation of respective data field. For example type STRING corresponds with StringDataField and its value is natively managed in a variable typed CloverString. This method returns just the class of the internal value representation of respective DataField. Moreover method DataField.getValue() returns an instance of this class.
    Returns:
    class of internal value representation of this type (CloverString.class for STRING, Integer.class for INTEGER, ...)
